title: A pickup’s persistent plastic pan problems
author: John Paul
bullets: A AAA Northeast Car Doctor advises repairing a 2018 Ford F-150's plastic oil pan under warranty despite persistent leaks.
Ford's metal oil pan costs $200 and requires twice the labor time to replace compared to the plastic version.
The reader considers selling their truck due to frequent oil pan issues and critiqued design choices in Ford vehicles.

title: Patriots get bad news with injuries ahead of Bucs matchup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Kayshon Boutte, Rhamondre Stevenson, and Garrett Bradbury missed practice due to injuries ahead of Bucs game.
New England may rely on rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams if Boutte and Stevenson are unavailable Sunday.
Bucs dealing with injuries, including wide receiver Mike Evans, with Chris Godwin and Bucky Irving missing practice.

title: Boston youth baseball coach pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Bryan Mejia, a youth baseball coach at Boston Athletic Academy, charged with trafficking over 10 grams of fentanyl.
Mejia, 31, allegedly sold fentanyl to an undercover officer, facing a felony charge with a sentence up to 20 years.
At his arraignment, Mejia pleaded not guilty and was released on personal recognizance; next court date is December 1.

title: Education technology company to close Boston headquarters, embrace fully remote workplace
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Cengage Group is closing its Boston, Detroit, and Cincinnati offices to adopt a fully remote work model.
The company formerly headquartered at 3 Center Plaza, Boston, now subleases office spaces and retains a location in Independence, Ky.
Cengage serves 90 million students in 125 countries, with nearly 4,000 employees and integration of generative AI in its platforms.

title: What Patriots players did during their off day that impressed Mike Vrabel
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel noted 41 Patriots players trained on their day off, indicating strong team commitment.
Stefon Diggs commented on the team's focus and identity as key factors in their success.
The Patriots, with a 7-2 record, aim to maintain their momentum into the season's second half.

title: Officials identify two killed in apparent murder-suicide in Beverly
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Becky Lynn Center, 58, and John Patrick Nesbitt, 56, were found dead in a Beverly home on Colonial Drive.
Essex County DA's Office identified the deaths as an apparent murder-suicide caused by gunshot wounds.
Beverly police, Massachusetts State Police, and Medical Examiner's Office are investigating the incident.

title: South Boston man linked to Bulger sentenced to 15 years for involvement in 1984, 1993 cold case killings
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Michael Lewis, linked to Whitey Bulger, sentenced to 15 years for 1984 and 1993 cold case killings.
Lewis pleaded guilty to manslaughter for the deaths of Brian Watson and William Villani, avoiding first-degree murder charges.
The plea deal was a compromise due to significant trial risks; prosecutors managed new evidence since 2009.

title: Olney: Red Sox ‘well-positioned’ to try and trade for Tigers ace Tarik Skubal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Tarik Skubal, current AL Cy Young winner, is a potential trade target for the Boston Red Sox this offseason.
The Tigers may trade Skubal due to his approaching free agency and expected high contract demands by 2026.
Boston possesses trade assets and financial capacity to pursue Skubal, competing with teams like the Mariners and Mets.

title: Judge temporarily halts patron saint statues in Quincy, but PETA wants to help
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Judge halted Quincy's installation of two patron saint statues outside the public safety building, pending legal review.
PETA proposed funding statues if Quincy includes a third statue of St. Francis of Assisi, emphasizing compassion for animals.
ACLU filed suit citing religious concerns; City hired Becket Fund to appeal judge's injunction preventing statue installation.

title: Bill Belichick commends Drake Maye for an ‘outstanding’ start with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick praised Drake Maye's performance on the 'Let's Go!' podcast, noting his strong season start with the Patriots.
Drake Maye has led New England to a 7-2 record, putting him in MVP contention with a 74.1% pass completion rate.
Belichick warned about potential regression, highlighting Maye's role in New England's unexpected success this season.
